messages.content: I live in Khao San, Bangkok. The temple spires and tuk-tuk chaos.
That sounds wonderful! What do you enjoy most about living there?
Every Saturday I love morning at Chatuchak Weekend Market for vintage finds.
That sounds like a great weekend routine!
My neighbor Niran, a muay thai trainer who takes me to local fights. We've become good friends.
It's nice to have friendly neighbors!
For breakfast I usually have pad thai and Thai iced tea from a street cart on Tanao Road.
Sounds delicious!
I'm relocating to Le Marais, Paris for a research fellowship!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be visiting Marché des Enfants Rouges for fresh crêpes.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have croissant and café crème at the boulangerie on Rue des Rosiers.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Le Marais, Paris for a few weeks now. I love the old buildings and hidden courtyards.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Madame Dupont, an artist who invites me for wine evenings.
What a wonderful connection!
I'm relocating to Nørrebro, Copenhagen for an art residency!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be cycling to Assistens Cemetery flea market.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have cardamom bun and filter coffee at Mirabelle.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Nørrebro, Copenhagen for a few weeks now. I love the bike-friendly streets and hygge culture.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Søren, a furniture designer who shares his homemade aquavit.
What a wonderful connection!
I'm relocating to Hongdae, Seoul for a creative collaboration!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be browsing independent record shops and catching busker performances.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have kimchi jjigae and rice at a 24-hour jjigaezip.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Hongdae, Seoul for a few weeks now. I love the neon-lit streets and live music scene.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Ji-woo, a K-indie musician who takes me to underground gigs.
What a wonderful connection!
I'm relocating to Recoleta, Buenos Aires for a remote work opportunity!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be browsing the Feria de Recoleta artisan market by the cemetery.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have facturas and submarino at a grand confitería on Avenida Alvear.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Recoleta, Buenos Aires for a few weeks now. I love the French-style mansions and jacaranda-lined streets.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Valentina, a psychoanalyst who explains Argentine culture over mate.
What a wonderful connection!

queries.question: What do I usually have for breakfast based on where I live now?

reference_answer.text: Since you currently live in Recoleta, Buenos Aires, your breakfast is facturas and submarino at a grand confitería on Avenida Alvear. The answer should NOT mention breakfast from your previous cities (Khao San pad thai and Thai iced tea from a street, Le Marais croissant and café crème, Nørrebro cardamom bun and filter coffee, Hongdae kimchi jjigae and rice).
